metadata.Title: CVE-2021-28277 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A Heap-based Buffer Overflow vulnerabilty exists in jhead 3.04 and 3.05 isaffected by: Buffer Overflow via the RemoveUnknownSections function injpgfile.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28277` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

jhead - 1:3.06.0.1-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: jhead package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.06.0.1-2').
